article_title: Raimondo defends proposed tax on health insurance premiums
article_text: Sign up for our newsletter and have the top headlines from your community delivered right to your inbox

article_metadata.description:
PROVIDENCE, R.I. — Governor Raimondo on Friday explained — and defended — the initial $6.2 million in "premium assessments'' she is seeking to collect from an estimated 123,000 health-insurance subscribers across Rhode Island in the first six months of 2016 to help finance the state-run Obamacare program known as HealthSource RI, as federal dollars run dry.
This new surcharge on premiums would not be limited to HealthSource RI's roughly 30,000 customers. It would
article_metadata.author: Katherine Gregg
